tableData.description: This agent evaluates author credibility and expertise based on various factors including credentials, experience, and recognition.
functions: Analyzes author byline presence and clarity
Evaluates author demonstrated expertise in topic
tableData.analysis: Page lacks a clear by_line, attributing authorship to a named expert. | Mentionsnutritionists &Performance Advisory Board but without names or links. | No verifiable credentials (LinkedIn, bios, external profiles). | Certifications (Informed Choice/Protein) relate to product, not authorship.
tableData.problems: Lack of a clear byline attributing the content to a specific author or expert. | Absence of demonstrated expertise or credentials for the individuals mentioned (e.g., Performance Advisory Board). | No verifiable author information such as professional profiles or external credentials.
tableData.recommendation: Include a clear byline with author name, expertise, and role. | Link Board members to profiles or cite credentials explicitly. | Add Person/Organization schema to mark up authorship metadata.

tableData.description: This agent evaluates the authority and credibility of content sources and backlinks to assess overall content authority.
functions: Evaluates presence in reputable directories and awards
tableData.analysis: Strong backlinks from Mens Health, Comparably, etc., raise domain authority. | Awards & eco-initiatives bolster credibility. | Authorship by in_house nutritionists & Advisory Board noted & certified by Informed Choice. | Review_platform scores (Trustpilot/Comparably_3.64.5/5) signal room to grow trust.
tableData.problems: Authoritativeness score is relatively low at 6. | Recognition & citation scores only 7.
tableData.recommendation: Improve customer trust & satisfaction to influence review scores. | Publicise awards & achievements more widely.| Diversify and strengthen citation sources.

tableData.description: This agent analyzes content clarity and brevity to assess readability and user comprehension.
functions: Measures heading hierarchy and logical flow

tableData.description: This agent analyzes content consistency and reliability to assess trustworthiness and credibility.
tableData.analysis: Consistent messaging on high protein & certifications across page. | Redundant discount/benefit text clutters layout.
tableData.problems: The product description and benefits sections sometimes use dense, jargon-heavy phrasing (e.g., “whey protein concentrate with an impressive 82% protein content”), which may be less accessible to casual or first-time buyers.
tableData.recommendation: Simplify and break up long, technical sentences into shorter, more conversational lines (e.g., “High-quality whey concentrate with 82% protein. Ideal for supporting muscle growth.”) to improve readability for all audiences.

tableData.description: This agent evaluates call-to-action elements and conversion optimization in content.
functions: Assesses user journey and conversion paths
tableData.analysis: Provides clear, practical usage recommendations. | Highlights holistic approach & safety. | Strong CTAs drive engagement and purchase.

tableData.description: This agent analyzes internal press coverage and media mentions to assess content expertise and industry recognition.
tableData.analysis: No dedicatedIn_the_Press or press_release hub.| MissingAs_Featured_In logos or media links. | Certifications mentioned but dont establish media presence.
tableData.problems: Lack of a dedicated press section. | Absence of media logos/links. | Limited collaboration with reputable publications.
tableData.recommendation: Create press/news page to showcase coverage. | Add clickableFeatured_In logos. | Pursue & display reputable media collaborations.

tableData.description: This agent analyzes internal reviews and user feedback to assess content quality and user satisfaction.
functions: Assesses user sentiment and feedback patterns
Measures content effectiveness and user satisfaction
tableData.analysis: Aggregate rating 4.36/5 (4,015 reviews) shows positive sentiment. | No personal success stories or detailed case studies. | Popularity claimTrusted by 2.4 million unaccompanied by individual experiences.
tableData.problems: Absence of personal success stories or detailed case studies.| Lack of specific recommendations or detailed testimonials.

tableData.description: This agent evaluates editorial policies and content standards to assess content quality and expertise.
tableData.analysis: Certifications cited but disclaimers absent on product pages. | No visibility into Advisory Board review process.
tableData.problems: Missing disclaimers on certifications/testing. | No info on how content is reviewed.
tableData.recommendation: Add visible certification disclaimers. | Explain Advisory Boards role in content review.

tableData.description: This agent measures user engagement and interaction patterns to assess content effectiveness and user interest.
tableData.analysis: Product wins major awards (e.g., Circular Economy Transition of the Year, 2021 A.A. Nutrition Taste Awards). | Informed Choice certification underscores quality. | Mentioned in sports_nutrition blogs/reviews; little presence on non_commercial platforms (Reddit, Quora). | Overall moderate credibility from awards + limited press variety.

tableData.description: This agent analyzes research depth and methodology to assess content expertise and credibility.
tableData.analysis: Bulk’s Pure Whey Protein™ page effectively promotes the product with nutritional details and flavor options but lacks original research, credible citations, and content originality.
tableData.problems: Lack of citations or references to support claims, undermining credibility. | Absence of original research or comparative studies to differentiate the product.
tableData.recommendation: Include citations or references for claims like the recommended protein intake per kilogram and benefits of BCAAs to ensure credibility.

tableData.description: This agent evaluates statistical data and evidence to assess content expertise and credibility.
tableData.analysis: Provides relevant quantitative stats (nutrition, customer reach) and and accolades but without external sources. | No links for certifications/data.
tableData.problems: No external citations or third party certification for stats. | Absence of independent lab testing information to boost credibility.
tableData.recommendation: Citations or third-party certifications for the nutritional data and statistics. |  Incorporate third-party testing outcomes

tableData.description: This agent analyzes organizational schema markup and structured data to assess content organization and discoverability.
tableData.analysis: Product JSON_LD schema fully implemented & valid. | Includes all key Product properties plus reviews & ratings. | Uses @id linking for entity consistency.

tableData.description: This agent analyzes conversational tone and natural language patterns in content.
tableData.analysis: Sections like Description & FAQ exist, but overall layout cluttered. | Repetitive promos overshadow critical info. | Dense copy may alienate readers. | Nutrition facts lack layman_friendly explanations.
tableData.problems: Cluttered, hard_to_navigate structure. | Excessive, repetitive promos. | Dense description. | Nutrition info not explained for lay readers.
tableData.recommendation: Simplify layout & cut duplicate content. | Highlight key info with concise bullets. | Extend conversational tone site_wide. | Add plain_language nutrition explainers.

tableData.description: This agent evaluates FAQ structure and content to assess user information accessibility.
functions: Evaluates FAQ content quality and relevance
tableData.analysis: FAQ answers packaging changes, certification, benefits, usage. | Suggested_use guidance offers practical instructions. | No directGet Help support links. | Lacks deep tutorials (recipes, fitness integration) & broader educational resources.
tableData.problems: Answers lack “why” or “when” context, making the content less informative and less useful for LLM grounding. | Questions and responses are written in a rigid, non-natural format, reducing alignment with how users actually search or speak.
tableData.recommendation: Add “why/when” context and practical comparisons | Reword FAQs in natural, user-style language.

tableData.description: This agent analyzes user journey optimization and conversion path analysis.
tableData.analysis: Covers user journey: benefits, certification, suggested use for decision & post_purchase stages. | It lacks granular content tailored to each stage of a user's purchasing journey.| Lacks beginner-friendly content for awareness-stage users. | No tools or guidance for product comparison.
tableData.problems: Lacks beginner-friendly content for awareness-stage users. | No tools or guidance for product comparison.
tableData.recommendation: Add a how-to guide linking goals to protein type. | Include a comparison chart for product clarity.

tableData.description: This agent analyzes user sentiment and emotional responses to content to gauge user satisfaction and engagement.
tableData.analysis: Mixed sentiment online: affordability praised; flavor & digestive issues flagged. | Active on Reddit, Quora; limited YouTube/Instagram presence. | Positive cost_quality ratio balanced by taste concerns links to moderate overall score.
tableData.problems: Flavor inconsistency concerns. | Digestive_issue reports. | Limited YouTube/IG visibility. | Negative sentiment on some forums.
tableData.recommendation: Encourage influencer video reviews. | Address negatives on Reddit/Quora. | Run IG/TikTok engagement campaigns. | Improve flavor consistency & formulation.

tableData.description: This agent evaluates company registration and legal compliance to assess business trustworthiness.
functions: Analyzes company registration and legal status
tableData.analysis: Product page omits company legal & registration details. | Parent entity (THG Nutrition) not referenced on page. | Greater transparency would increase trust.
tableData.problems: The company registration details are not displayed on the product page itself, requiring users to navigate to the Terms and Conditions page to find them. | Visibility of legal entity information is low for casual shoppers who may never check the Terms page.
tableData.recommendation: Add a clear “Company Information” section or footer note on product pages with the legal entity name, registration number, and address. | Include a brief company registration summary on the checkout page or in the website footer for easier, more visible access.

tableData.description: This agent analyzes contact information and accessibility to assess business transparency and trust.
tableData.analysis: Contact page lists toll_free phone, email, physical address, message centre. | Info current & comprehensive. | Main product page lacks quick access to contact link.
tableData.problems: No phone number provided anywhere on the website, which limits customer support options and can reduce trust. | Physical address is not shown directly on the Contact Us page, making it slightly harder for users to verify the business location.
tableData.recommendation: Add a direct customer service phone number on the Contact Us page to increase trust and offer more support options. | Display the physical business address directly on the Contact Us page (not just in FAQs) to improve transparency and make it easier for customers to verify the company.

tableData.description: This agent evaluates ecommerce policies and security measures to assess online business trustworthiness.
tableData.analysis: Returns policy (28_day window, photo proof, refund/replace terms) and delivery info (36 days, free shipping>_5000, tracking) clear & accessible. | Links reside in customer_service section; could be more visible on product pages.
tableData.problems: No Returns Policy page found | Incomplete Delivery Info (no clear shipping details) | Returns Policy exists but only in Help/Support, not on product page
tableData.recommendation: Add a clear Returns Policy page with refund terms, timeframes, and steps |  Fill out Delivery Info with shipping costs, times, carriers, and tracking. | Make both pages easy to find in the footer and FAQs with clear headings like “Delivery & Shipping” and “Returns & Refunds.”

tableData.description: This agent analyzes content freshness and update frequency to assess information reliability and trustworthiness.
functions: Analyzes content freshness and update frequency
tableData.analysis: last updated is not present in the html meta tag | last updated is not present in the json-ld schema | last updated infered from latest review added by customers
tableData.problems: No visible “last updated” or “published” date on the product page—users can't see when content was last reviewed or changed. Only date found is the HTTP last-modified header (e.g., “Fri, 28 Jun 2024”), which is hidden from users and doesn’t clarify what was updated. Lack of clear, user-facing date reduces trust in content freshness, especially important for product details like ingredients or nutrition.
tableData.recommendation: Add a clearly visible “Last Updated” date on the product page to show when the description and nutritional info were last reviewed. | Include specific details about what was updated, e.g., “Ingredients updated June 2024,” to improve transparency and user trust.

tableData.description: This agent evaluates policy pages and legal information to assess business transparency and compliance.
functions: Analyzes policy page completeness and clarity
tableData.analysis: Privacy Policy & Terms/Conditions clear and linked in footer. | No dedicated Cookie Policy. | Lacks copyright notice & formal complaints procedure.
tableData.problems: No visible or formal complaints handling procedure. | Cookie notice is present but less discoverable. | Complaints procedure is minimal (only mentions contacting customer service).
tableData.recommendation: Add a clear, dedicated Complaints Handling Procedure page outlining steps, timescales, and escalation options. | Make the Cookie Policy more discoverable by providing a standalone, clearly labeled link in the footer or header. | Expand the complaints information beyond a simple “contact us” note to include a structured procedure users can follow.

tableData.description: This agent evaluates content uniqueness and originality to assess competitive differentiation.
tableData.analysis: Uses only generic product images; no unique media illustrating real_world use. | Claims likeTrusted by 2.4 million & Informed Choice certification lack external validation. | Few first_person testimonials or unique insights.
tableData.problems: Lack of unique media showing real use. | No external validation for big claims. | Limited relatable testimonials.
tableData.recommendation: Add real_life photos/videos. | Cite external proof for trust claims. | Include customer stories or quotes.
